cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 18th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
G.T.5718
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the ST. QUENTIN battle front the line is reported to run as follows :- HOLNON, FRESNOY, west of PONTRUET with patrols in the village), FARM one mile south-east of VILLERET, SUGAR FACTORY east of HARGICOURT, FARM 800 yards east of LEMPIRE, CATELET COPSE (2,000 yards north of LEMPIRE), south-western edge of VILLERS-GUISLAIN, GAUCHE WOOD, south-western edge of GOUZEAUCOURT, (all inclusive).
From 3,000 to 4,000 prisoners are reported to have been taken and a few guns. One battery complete with horses was captured.
French Front.
South of HOLNON the French have taken FONTAINE-LES-CLERCS and are in the western edge of DALLON. They are also in the wood south of the BOIS DE SAVY and have taken FRANCILLY.
2. ITALIAN FRONT.
No change.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
On the battle front the Allied line ran as follows at 10 p.m. on 17th September :- ZBORSKO (inclusive), one mile north-west of ZBORSKO, HILL 1800 (highest point of KUCHKOV ?), VITOLISHTA, MELYNITSA, ZOVIK (all inclusive).
The total of captured guns has risen to over 50.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
18th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.50 p.m.
